sen.j: 円融天皇（えんゆうてんのう、天徳 (日本)3年3月2日（959年4月12日） - 正暦2年2月12日（991年3月1日）； 在位：安和2年9月23日（969年11月5日） - 永観2年8月27日（984年9月24日））は、第64代の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor ENYU (April 12th, 959 - March 1st, 991), his reign was November 5th, 969 - September 24th, 984, he was he 64th Emperor.
Emperor Enyu (April 12, 959 - March 1, 991) was the sixty-fourth Emperor (his reign was November 5, 969 to September 24, 984).
Emperor Enyu (April 12, 959 - March 1, 991) was the sixty-fourth Emperor (his reign was November 5, 969 to September 24, 984).

sen.j: 諱は守平（もりひら）。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Morihira.
His posthumous name was Morihira.
His posthumous name was Morihira.

sen.j: 村上天皇の第五皇子で、母は右大臣藤原師輔の娘、中宮藤原安子。
sen.e: He was the 5th Prince of Emperor MURAKAMI and his mother was the second consort of an emperor, FUJIWARA no Anshi who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morosuke, the Minister of the right.
He was the fifth prince of Emperor Murakami, and his mother was an Emperor's second consort, FUJIWARA no Anshi, who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morosuke, the minister of the right.
He was the fifth prince of Emperor Murakami, and his mother was an Emperor's second consort, FUJIWARA no Anshi, who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morosuke, the minister of the right.

sen.j: 冷泉天皇の同母弟。
sen.e: He was the half younger brother of Emperor REIZEI.
He was the younger half-brother of Emperor Reizei.
He was the younger half-brother of Emperor Reizei.

sen.j: すぐ上の同母姉資子内親王と仲がよく、これを一品に叙した。
sen.e: He had a close relationship with his older sister, Princess Shishinai and she was conferred a rank of Ippon Shinno, the highest rank given to Imperial families.
sen.cmt: 一品に叙した を、一品親王の意味に英訳、定訳不明
sen.e: He had a close relationship with his older sister, Princess Shishinai, and she was conferred the rank of Ippon Shinno, the highest rank given to a member of the Imperial Family.
He had a close relationship with his older sister, Princess Shishinai, and she was conferred the rank of Ippon Shinno, the highest rank given to a member of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: はじめ関白藤原兼通の娘媓子を中宮とし、天元2年（979年）に彼女が亡くなると、代わって関白藤原頼忠の娘遵子を中宮に立てた。
sen.e: Initially, the Chancellor (chief adviser to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Kanemichi's daughter Koshi became Emperor's second consort, after she died (979), the Chancellor (chief adviser to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Kanemichi's daughter Junshi took over her position.

Initially, the chancellor (chief adviser to the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Kanemichi's daughter Koshi became the Emperor's second consort, but after she died (in 979), the Chancellor (chief adviser to the Emperor), FUJIWARA no Kanemichi's daughter Junshi took over her position.

Initially, the chancellor (chief adviser to the Emperor) FUJIWARA no Kanemichi's daughter Koshi became the Emperor's second consort, but after she died (in 979), Junshi, daughter of the chancellor FUJIWARA no Yoritada, took over her position.

sen.j: また、藤原兼家の次女藤原詮子を入内させ、詮子との間には唯一の皇子女、懐仁親王（後の一条天皇）が産まれている。
sen.e: Also the Emperor approved FUJIWARA Kaneie's second daughter, FUJIWARA no Senshi to enter into Imperial Palace as Consort's bridal, she gave a birth to an only Prince, Yasuhito. (later called Emperor ICHIJO)

Also, the Emperor gave approval for FUJIWARA Kaneie's second daughter, FUJIWARA no Senshi, to enter the Imperial Palace as a consort bride; she gave a birth to an only prince, Yasuhito (later called Emperor Ichijo).

Also, the Emperor gave approval for FUJIWARA no Kaneie's second daughter, FUJIWARA no Senshi, to enter the Imperial Palace as a consort bride; she gave birth to an only prince, Yasuhito (later called Emperor Ichijo).

tit.cmt: Biography→Brief Personal Historyに変更しました。

sen.j: 康保4年（967年）9月1日、九歳にして、同母兄の為平親王を飛び越えて立太子。
sen.e: On September 1st, 967, he became Crown Prince instead of his older brother, Prince Tamehira to become Crown Prince.
On September 1, 967, he became the crown prince instead of his older brother, Prince Tamehira.
On September 1, 967, he became the crown prince at the age of nine instead of his older brother, Imperial Prince Tamehira.
sen.cmt: at the age of nine の訳を補足"Prince"→"Imperial Prince"に変更しました。

sen.j: それ以前には3ヶ月余りにわたる皇太子の空位があった。
sen.e: Before that, no one succeeded the position of Crown Prince for three months.
Prior to that point, there was a three-month period in which no one succeeded to the position of crown prince
Prior to that point, there was a three-month period in which no one succeeded to the position of crown prince

sen.j: 為平親王が源高明の娘を妃にしていたため、これを嫌った藤原氏の策略による安和の変で、源高明が失脚すると、冷泉天皇の譲りを受けて即位した。
sen.e: The FUJIWAEA clan caused the Anna Incident as they did not like Prince Tamehira having Empress who is a daughter of MINAMOTO no Takaakira, after he lost his position, Emperor ENYU became a successor followed by Emperor REIZEI.

The FUJIWAEA clan caused the Anna Incident as they did not like Prince Tamehira having Empress who is a daughter of MINAMOTO no Takaakira, after he lost his position, Emperor Enyu became a successor followed by Emperor Reizei.

The Fujiwara clan caused the Anna Incident, as they did not like Imperial Prince Tamehira having an empress who was a daughter of MINAMOTO no Takaakira; so, after he lost his position, Emperor Enyu became a successor, followed by Emperor Reizei.

sen.j: 即位時11歳であったので、太政大臣藤原実頼（さねより）が摂政に就いた。
sen.e: The Emperor was eleven years when he enthroned, so the Grand Minister, FUJIWARA no Saneyori became a regent.
The Emperor was 11 years when he was enthroned, so the grand minister, FUJIWARA no Saneyori, became a regent.
The Emperor was 11 years old when he was enthroned, so the grand minister, FUJIWARA no Saneyori, became a regent.

sen.j: 天禄元年（970年）に実頼が薨去すると、天皇の外舅藤原伊尹（これまさ）が摂政を引き継いだ。
sen.e: After Saneyori died in 970, Emperor's father in law, FUJIWARA no Koremasa took over the position of the regent.
After Saneyori died in 970, the Emperor's father-in-law, FUJIWARA no Koremasa, took over the position of regent.
After Saneyori died in 970, the Emperor's father-in-law, FUJIWARA no Koremasa, took over the position of regent.

sen.j: 同三年、伊尹が在職一年あまりで亡くなると、その弟の兼通・兼家の間で、摂関職を巡って熾烈なる争いが行われた。
sen.e: In 972 after Koremasa died about one year of being in his position, there was a fierce battle between his brothers, Kanemichi and Kaneie to take over the position of the regent.
In 972, after Koremasa died after about a year in his position, there was a fierce battle between his brothers, Kanemichi and Kaneie, to take over the position of regent.
In 972, after Koremasa died after about a year in his position, there was a fierce battle between his brothers, Kanemichi and Kaneie, to take over the position of regent.

sen.j: 天皇は亡母の遺訓に従って兼通を関白に任じて、さらに貞元2年（977年）に関白兼通が重病に陥ると、兼通の要望に従って遠縁の藤原頼忠を後任とした。
sen.e: The Emperor appointed Kanemichi as the Chancellor (chief adviser to the emperor), following his mother's will, after that Kanemichi became very ill and the Emperor appointed FUJIWARA no Yoritada, distant relative, to take over Kanemichi's position, as this was Kanemichi's wish.

The Emperor appointed Kanemichi as the chancellor (chief adviser to the Emperor), following his mother's will, but after that Kanemichi became very ill and the Emperor appointed FUJIWARA no Yoritada, a distant relative, to take over Kanemichi's position, since this was Kanemichi's wish.

The Emperor appointed Kanemichi as the chancellor, following his mother's will, but after that Kanemichi became very ill in 977 and the Emperor appointed FUJIWARA no Yoritada, a distant relative, to take over Kanemichi's position, since that was Kanemichi's wish.

sen.j: これは兼通の権勢もあるが、兼家が当時兄の冷泉上皇には娘・藤原超子を納れていたにも関わらず、天皇である自分の許には娘を納れていなかったために天皇も兼家に含むところがあり娘・遵子を納れていた頼忠の方に好意を抱いていたとする見方もある。
sen.e: This was partly due to Kanemitsu's power, however there is a theory Emperor Enyu preferred Yoritada who sent his daughter, Shunshi to him, on the other hand, Kaneie did not send any of his daughters to Emperor ENYU although he did it to the ex-Emperor Reizei, so the Emperor did not have total trust in Kaneie.

This was partly due to Kanemitsu's power; one theory asserts that Emperor Enyu preferred Yoritada, who sent his daughter Shunshi to him, but on the other hand Kaneie did not send any of his daughters to Emperor Enyu, although he did it to the ex-Emperor Reizei, so the Emperor did not have complete trust in Kaneie.

This was partly due to Kanemichi's power; one theory asserts that Emperor Enyu preferred Yoritada, who had sent his daughter Junshi to him, but on the other hand Kaneie did not send any of his daughters to Emperor Enyu, although he did so for the Retired Emperor Reizei, so the Emperor did not have complete trust in Kaneie.

sen.j: その後兼家も娘・詮子を納れ、天皇の唯一の皇子女である一条天皇（懐仁親王）を儲ける。
sen.e: After that Kaneie sent his daughter, Senshi to the Emperor, Senshi gave a birth to the Emperor's only Prince, Emperor ICHIJO (Prince Yasuhito).
Subsequently, Kaneie sent his daughter Senshi to the Emperor, and Senshi gave birth to the Emperor's only prince, Yasuhito (later Emperor Ichijo).
Subsequently, Kaneie sent his daughter Senshi to the Emperor, and Senshi gave birth to the Emperor's only prince, Yasuhito (later Emperor Ichijo).

sen.j: にもかかわらず、「素腹の后」遵子を中宮に立てた。
sen.e: In spite of above, the Emperor appointed Junshi who can not have children, as the second consort of an emperor.
sen.cmt: 素腹の后 定訳不明
sen.e: Despite the above, the Emperor appointed Junshi, who could not have children, as the second consort of an Emperor.
Despite the above, the Emperor appointed Junshi, who could not have children, as the second consort of an Emperor.

sen.j: 一連のことは兼家の恨みを買い、彼は娘詮子・外孫懐仁親王ともども、里第に籠って出仕しなかった。
sen.e: A chain of events made Kaneie had a grudge against the Emperor, Kaneie went back hometown with Senshi and Prince Yasuhito, and never let them return to the Palace.
A chain of events led Kaneie to hold a grudge against the Emperor; consequently, Kaneie returned to his hometown with Senshi and Prince Yasuhito, and never let them return to the palace.
A chain of events led Kaneie to hold a grudge against the Emperor; consequently, Kaneie returned to his hometown with Senshi and Prince Yasuhito, and never let them return to the palace.

sen.j: これに対して天皇も2度の内裏の焼失の際に故兼通邸の堀河殿（退位後も御所として使用）や関白頼忠邸を仮の御所として兼家への依存を拒むなど、両者の緊張関係が続く事になる。
sen.e: On the other hand the Emperor tried not to rely on Kaneie by using Kanemichi's Palace, Horikawa dono (residence) (it was still used after the Emperor abdicated the throne) or using the Chancellor (chief adviser to the emperor), Yoritada's Palace as temporally palace when there was a fire in two occasions in the palace, the relationship between the Emperor and Kaneie was sensitive.

On the other hand, the Emperor tried not to rely on Kaneie by using Kanemichi's palace, Horikawa dono (residence) (it was still used after the Emperor abdicated the throne) or using the palace of Chancellor Yoritada as a temporary palace when, on two occasions, fires occurred in the palace, so the relationship between the Emperor and Kaneie was sensitive.

On the other hand, the Emperor tried not to rely on Kaneie by using Kanemichi's palace, Horikawa dono (residence) (it was still used after the Emperor abdicated the throne) or using the palace of Chancellor Yoritada as a temporary palace when, on two occasions, fires occurred in the palace, so the relationship between the Emperor and Kaneie was sensitive.

sen.j: かように藤原氏の勢力争いに翻弄され、永観2年（984年）、懐仁親王の立太子を条件に花山天皇に譲位。
sen.e: Thus the Emperor was at the mercy of power struggle within FUJIWARA clan and he abdicated and passed the throne to Emperor KAZAN in 984 after Prince Yasuhito became Crown Prince.
Thus the Emperor was at the mercy of a power struggle within the FUJIWARA clan, and he abdicated and passed the throne to Emperor Kazan in 984 after Prince Yasuhito became the crown prince.
Thus the Emperor was at the mercy of a power struggle within the Fujiwara clan, and he abdicated and passed the throne to Emperor Kazan in 984 after Imperial Prince Yasuhito became the crown prince.

sen.j: 一条朝には幼帝を指導して強い発言権を持ち、院政の意図があったともいうが不詳。
sen.e: It is said the during Emperor ICHIJO'd reign, Emperor Enyu seized the strong leadership towards young Emperor, ICHIJO, and intended to rule a cloister government however it is unknown.
It is said that during Emperor Ichijo's reign, Emperor Enyu seized strong leadership over the young Emperor Ichijo, and intended to rule a cloister government; however, this isn't certain.
It is said that during Emperor Ichijo's reign, Emperor Enyu seized strong leadership over the young Emperor Ichijo, and intended to rule a cloister government; however, this isn't certain.

tit.e: Posthumous name, Tsuigo, a different name
Posthumous name, Tsuigo, a different name

sen.j: 退位後は後院の名に因み、朱雀院上皇と称される。
sen.e: After he abdicated from the throne, he was called ex-Emperor Suzaku-in, named after go in which is the candidate place for the emperor to stay after their abdication from the throne.
After he abdicated from the throne, he was called ex-Emperor Suzaku-in, named after "go," which is the candidate place for the Emperor to stay after abdicating the throne.
After he abdicated from the throne, he was called Retired Emperor Suzaku-in, named after go-in, which was a candidate place for the Emperor to stay after abdicating the throne.
sen.cmt: go→go-in原文にない" "を削除"ex-Emperor"→"Retired Emperor"に変更しました。

sen.j: 寛和元年（985）8月、寛朝大僧正の授戒により出家し、以後円融寺に住む。
sen.e: In 985 he was given the commandments of the priesthood by Kancho Dai-sojo (the head priest of a Buddhist sect), and became a priest, then lived in Enyu-ji Temple.
In 985 he was given the orders of the priesthood by Kancho Dai-sojo (the head priest of a Buddhist sect), and became a priest, whereupon he lived at Enyu-ji Temple.
In August 985 he was given the orders of the priesthood by Kancho Dai-sojo (the head priest of a Buddhist sect), and became a priest, whereupon he lived at Enyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: よって死後「円融院」と追号。
sen.e: Due to above, he was given posthumous name, 'Enyu-in' after he died.
Due to the above, upon his death he was given the posthumous name 'Enyu-in.'
Due to the above, upon his death he was given the posthumous name 'Enyu-in.'

sen.j: 安和
sen.e: Anna
Anna
Anna

sen.j: 天禄
sen.e: Tenroku
Tenroku
Tenroku

sen.j: 天延
sen.e: Ten-en
Ten-en
Ten-en

sen.j: 貞元
sen.e: Jogen
Jogen
Jogen

sen.j: 天元
sen.e: Tengen
Tengen
Tengen

sen.j: 永観
sen.e: Eigan, Eikan
Eigan, Eikan
Eigan, Eikan

sen.j: 陵墓は京都市右京区宇多野福王子町にある後村上陵（のちのむらかみのみささぎ）。
sen.e: His mausoleum is Nochino murakami no Misasagi, located at Fukuoji-cho Town, Utano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
His mausoleum is Nochino murakami no Misasagi, located at Fukuoji-cho Town, Utano, in the Ukyo ward of Kyoto City.
His mausoleum is Nochino murakami no Misasagi, located at Fukuoji-cho Town, Utano, in the Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City.

sen.j: また全ての天皇は皇居の宮中三殿の一つの皇霊殿に祀られている。
sen.e: All the past Emperors are enshrined in Koreiden, one of the Three Palace Sanctuaries.
All the past emperors are enshrined in Koreiden, one of the three palace sanctuaries.
All the past emperors are enshrined in Koreiden, one of the three palace sanctuaries.
